title: [BEAM-12164]: Add SDF for reading change stream records
body:
Adds ReadChangeStreamPartitionDoFn, which is an SDF to read partitions from change streams and process them accordingly. This component receives a change stream name, a partition, a start time and an end time to query. It then initiates a change stream query with the received parameters.

Within a change stream, 3 types of records can be received:

1. A Data record
2. A Heartbeat record
3. A Child partitions record

Upon receiving (1), the function updates the watermark with the record's commit timestamp and emits the record into the output PCollection.
Upon receiving (2), the function updates the watermark with the record's timestamp, but it does not emit any record into the PCollection.
Upon receiving (3), the function updates the watermark with the record's timestamp and writes the new child partitions into the metadata table. These partitions will be later scheduled by the DetectNewPartitions component.

Once the change stream query for the element partition finishes, it marks the partition as finished in the metadata table and terminates.

title: [BEAM-13137] Fixes ES utest size flakiness with _flush api and index.store.stats_refresh_interval=0
body:
Address Elasticsearch Unit Test Flakiness ------------------------ Fixes BEAM-13137 and possibly BEAM-5172. Elasticsearch read/split/size has often been flaky in unit tests, and it may be due to the non-deterministic nature of `_flush` whereby data buffered in the translog of ES is flushed to the index; this process happens independently of index `refresh`. Adding explicit use of flush has stabilized tests locally. Next step is to see if this translates to stability in automated unit tests. Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-13653] Fix usage of SnsIO.write topicArn (AWS Sdk v2)
body:
The usage of `SnsIO.write` is rather unintuitive at the moment. `topicArn` is a required configuration and during `expand` the existence of the topic is validated. However, the user also has to provide a function to build an SNS publish request. The `topicArn` for that publish request can be set as well, but can be different from the one configured and validated in the writer. This can be confusing and makes any validation pointless. The new behavior is as follows: - If `topicArn` is set for `SnsIO.write` it is validated during `expand`. That `topicArn` is also set for each publish request (and may override another `topicArn` if already set). - if `topicArn` is not set, no validation is done. The user is expected to set the `topicArn` on the publish request builder or provide an alternative such as a `targetArn`. Also, after validation the SNS client instance was previously not closed. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-12240] - Code changes comprising BEAM-12313 and BEAM-12314
body:
Adding eight new tests for DataFlow and one Direct runner test, along with the necessary configurations, e.g. Gradle JavaToolchain, SDK 17 path, etc. The JavaToolchain was added so that compilation using SDK8 and execution with SDK17 was possible. Only three tests are ran this way. The --add-opens flag was added to the sdk/java/harness/guild.gradle file to bypass the exception thrown by the JAMM library as it uses a few java.lang.reflection methods which SDK17 doesn't like. Beware that the aforementioned change should be done for all modules that exist on the classpath and only access to jamm should be provided; per https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15675/#issuecomment-1007801930 Also, the docker repo for the image is here: https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/apache/beam_java17_sdk Edit: The test executed by trigger "Run Load Tests Java 17 CoGBK Dataflow V2 Streaming" is the one throwing the InaccessibleObjectException. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12164]: SpannerIO DetectNewPartitions SDF
body:
Adds the DetectNewPartitions SDF. This component will be responsible for:

  - Emitting a watermark based on the min of all unfinished partitions in the metadata table.
  - Querying all partitions in the CREATED state.
  - Updating the created partitions to SCHEDULED state.
  - Emitting the scheduled partitions to the PCollection.

This SDF will run periodically as based on the configured resume interval (default is 100ms, best effort).

Adds the full class of all the metrics that we might expose from the Connector.

title: Loosen typing extensions bound
body:
Follow up to this [pr](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15233). A couple months ago we loosen typing extensions to any typing extensions <4. Well, typing extensions release a version 4 that is backwards compatible with 3 as they no longer want to follow python versions. The old versioning of typing extensions was based on python version (3.10 meant python 3.10 features). So we should support version 4 at least.

Typing extensions is about to release a version 5 too. The only backwards incompatible change is typing extensions version 5 drops support for 3.6 now that it is end of life. That should be safe as someone using 3.6 will automatically pick version 4 at most due to [python_requires](https://github.com/python/typing/blob/dea3e3eefb92748559fb8e2202f3e2d70a8d8517/typing_extensions/pyproject.toml#L25) line in typing extensions. I think backwards incompatible typing-extensions change except for EOL python is very unlikely as it would break typeshed/typing ecosystem. So I do not think beam needs to upper bound typing extensions. beam is only package out of 100s I depend on that upper bounds typing-extensions. 

The upper bound is currently blocking some usage of newer type features (pep [655](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0655/) requires typing extensions 4). I expect tensorflow/pytorch/numpy to all want to use TypeVarTuple in the near future because it allows proper tensor shape typing. That will be feature of typing extensions 5 in the near future.

@chadrik @udim @tvalentyn

title: [BEAM-13574] Large Wordcount
body:
Adds a more complex example pipeline demonstrating a more production oriented wordcount. * Uses the SDF based textio read * Sorts the output as long as keys fit in a single machine's memory * Shards the output based on the output spec (or based on shard configuration.) * Uses the Filesystem abstraction for "atomic" renames. * Uses Map Side inputs. * Tests the pipeline with passert & metrics querying. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13602] Prevented metrics gathering from failing bigtable io
body:
1. bigtable mutate row might return None instead of Status when running into retryable errors. Handled the special case as DEADLINE_EXCEEDED because bigtable must have exhausted the retry timeout or when there is no retry policy inplace. 2. title: [BEAM-13599] Fix overflow error in Python Datastore RampupThrottlingFn
body:
An intermediate value is a float dependent on start time, meaning it can run into overflows in long-running pipelines (usually on the ~6th day). The RemoteExecutionTest checks that the token makes it e2e and is cached across bundles for iterable side input, multimap side input and bag user state.
